conclusion: Consider forces acting on A and geometry of the scene
Identify gravity as a force acting on A
Identify collisions with blocks as a force acting on A
Collision will occur when A reaches bottom of cone-shaped structure
Cone will have sharp edge causing A to be deflected or redirected
A's velocity will be constant until it reaches bottom of cone
Assume cone height is small relative to size of blocks
Velocity of A can be calculated using formula v = âˆš(2gh)
Assume height of cone is 10 cm for simplicity
Calculate velocity of A as approximately 1.4 m/s
A will reach bottom of cone in approximately 0.1 seconds
Distance from top of cone to bottom is approximately 0.1 m
A will fall 0.1 m in 0.1 seconds, a distance of 10 cm
A will fall 10 cm from top of cone
Blocks will be at bottom of cone
A will be 10 cm above bottom of cone
A will eventually collide with blocks and land 10 cm above bottom of cone
